p: Ruiz-Ramos et al. (this issue) use an ex post plausibility check in ensemble wheat modelling, which usefully goes some way towards increasing robustness. However, comparability across risk assessment is only possible when some common methods or protocols are used (see e.g. Liu et al., 2016). Systematic assessments of the response of models to carbon dioxide, temperature, water and nitrogen have been suggested as a way to clearly understand and document model performance ( Ruane et al., 2014, Rosenzweig et al., 2013b). The response of the model to changes in key input variables should match what is seen in observations, and a systematic comparison method would aid this assessment.
